title: Mechanical sans serif characters on side of airplane
content:
I came close with Helvetica Bold and Europa - but close isnt good enough ;-).

Reminds me of licence plates in the UK....

Thanks in advance.

B

 [‹ Zidane French shirt numbers on Adidas soccer jerseys](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155733/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28716 "Go to previous forum topic") [Lupe Fiasco Fontstyle ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155733/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28889 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cobramist

comments.content: Is this from the side of a plane or something? Looks very mechanical.
Yes - it is an aircraft registration - nice catch :-)
:^) I’d guess this _is_ mechanical then and you will only find semi-matches. Sorry.

Not an exact match by any means, but the letters are very close to [DIN Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155733/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.9467.14.4&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=6+ABD&sampleSize=96).

If you’re looking to match UK license plates, check out [Mandatory](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155733/http:/www.1001fonts.com/font_details.html?font_id=2918).

Tiff’s right on about the lack of font matches. Another option: [CP Company](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155733/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=4&displayfontid=SD.112006.0.0&fontRendererText=6-ABD).

thank you all - for the info - very kind

cheers  
brian
